page.title: 17AMENITIES IN RISELEY(2)
page.content: The Chapmans who have a small farm have recently started a butchers in the converted utility room at the back of their house. They sell pork from their own pigs which are sent away for slaughter and then butchered by a retired butcher who lives in Maple Gardens. The beef they sell is sometimes from their own bullock. In addition to these facilites in the village there are several mobile services - two butchers bring their vans twice a week, two fishmongers come once a week, the baker three times, a library van twice, and milk is delivered daily to each house by one of two milkmen.
